title: Ban just for talking to much?
body:
So I just got chat-restricted for the below game, and I'm more just curious than anything. I honest to god don't think anything that I said was really toxic in the slightest, so I'm assuming I got reported simply for the amount that I said. I'll freely admit that I'm someone who can get drawn into arguments if people are saying shit and that's what happened here. I just wasn't aware that it was considered a punishable offense by riot simply to talk to much. If it is, well, fair enough I guess. I wouldn't necessarily agree with that policy, but it's their company. My main questions to y'all are: Do you think it was something besides the volume? If not, do y'all know where it specifies that volume is something you can be punished for? And third, is there any way if I can at least see if some of the other people got punished lol. I've added annotations to help provide context that I guess you'll have to take my word on being truthful but that's the best I can do. This was norms btw, so I wasn't taking it overly seriously.

Folks can agree or disagree with punishments, so please stop calling others "trolls" and what not.

If you disagree with a punishment, the best you should do is say so, and direct them to [Support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com) where they can get assistance.

You spend a lot of time talking about how it's over and you want to forfeit, and the second half of your chat log was pretty much devoted to flaming and arguing with the Amumu. Now that your chat is restricted, you'll have to make a choice between chat messages like "I thought veig was going mid when I picked syndra" (acceptable) and ones like "do you need a shovel for this hole you keep digging for your account amumu?" (not acceptable).

>
> Riot isn't telling you how to feel. They're telling you what'll get you punished, and this is it. Either stop doing this or get more punishments.

All Riot is telling me is this:

Transmitting or communicating any content which we reasonably believe to be offensive to players, including language that is unlawful, harmful, threatening, abusive, harassing, defamatory, vulgar, obscene, sexually explicit, or racially, ethically, or otherwise objectionable;

That's it. That's a fairly vague descriptor of "what'll get (me) punished." I can very easily argue that nothing I said or did in chat comes close to any of the qualifies, or I can argue that almost anything falls under them. That's intentional because Riot wants broad leeway to not have to deal with legal issues based on its application of the rule. The summoner's code is even more vague and is more just a set of maxims to live by to be the ultimate positive teammate than a descriptor of what qualifies as punishable action. So it's pretty absurd to act like Riot is telling me what'll get me punished when their description of it is so vague to include anything.  If I'm just missing somewhere they've more clearly described this than please let me know, because I think the most toxic thing I said all game was "do you need a shovel for this hole you keep digging for your account amumu?" And that's certainly not: threatening, harassing, defamatory, vulgar, obscene, sexually explicit, or racially/ethically objectionable. Which leaves it to fall under possible abusive, "otherwise objectionable," or just generally "what (they) reasonably bellieve to be offensive to plays. I'm sorry, but it's definitely not clearly abusive. And the other two are so unclear as to be useless for what constitutes "what'll get (me) punished"

When you yourself recognize that you get into arguments, when you yourself know what your least acceptable chat message was, your attempt at rules-lawyering falls flat. You know your chat wasn't great; fix it. Don't get into useless arguments that end up with you yammering away to someone who is never ever going to do what you want them to do. Don't call people out for their score. Don't fill the chat with "gg time to ff why can't we surrender i'm done with this game." Focus on behaving yourself rather than trying to get away with as much shit as you can, because you're not as good at toeing the line as you hoped you are.

Notice how you started out okay, making some jokes and talking about lane opponents, but you quickly decided that the match was lost and you spent the rest of the time talking about that and arguing with someone who was flaming you. When you are chat restricted, perhaps you'll use your limited messages to be friendly or constructive.

https://support-leagueoflegends.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884

Negative behavior is unacceptable regardless of the circumstances or who started it. It can be tempting to respond to negative players with negativity of your own. Our systems do not care who started the behavior and will treat each reported player based off the merits of their own case. The only way to handle these types of players is to mute them and continue playing the game followed by giving them a report at the end of the match.

Typing a lot is not forbidden. It may be annoying for the others but not forbidden as long as you remain neutral or positive. 

There is no punishment based on volume of typing, its based on signs of negativity/toxicity/griefing. The first half of your chat logs is ok, but not the second half.

I'm usually one to go through a log and point out the toxic moments but this really isn't bad. You weren't positive to be sure but this does not seem like it should have been punished, especially if this was the only log given. Contact player support for some clarity maybe?
